thread.title_full: Jabalpur shivers at 6.1 degrees Celsius | Bhopal News - Times of India

author: Times Of India
title: Jabalpur shivers at 6.1 degrees Celsius | Bhopal News - Times of India
text: Jabalpur: Cold wave conditions and a sharp decline in temperatures have affected daily lives in Jabalpur town. Streets wear deserted look during evening hours as people prefer to stay indoor.The minimum temperature recorded on Friday in the town was 6.1 degrees Celsius, which is 5 degrees below normal. The maximum temperature recorded was 23.3 degrees Celsius, also 5 degrees below normal. On this day last year, the minimum temperature was 12.5 degrees, and the maximum was 24.5 degrees Celsius. North-westerly winds are blowing at a speed of 5 to 6 km per hour.The cold wave has intensified the chill. Despite the sunshine during the day, the cold wave continues to have an impact. As evening approaches, the cold becomes more severe. Schools timing will remained unchanged. Collector Deepak Saxena said no proposal has been received from the school department to change school timings for the morning session as of now. The collector has the authority to alter school timings if the temperature falls below five degrees, he said.
